For each group 3 variables will be created in the unifi variables folder Unifi_Count_grpname_Home Unifi_Count_grpname_Away Unifi_Count_grpname_lastChange You can add devices to a group (in device edit or do a mass change in menu manage groups) and trigger on any change variable UniFi_Count_groupname_Home / Away value ==0 or max or 1 0 = none home / away, 0 to 1= one home/ away, max = all home / away Or trigger on any change in variable ..lastChange to check if anything device from that group came home or left
== user IDs for systems (leave empty if not used), no ' " GT LT | # in your passwords!!

List.Option: hosted eg MAC, rPi, .. (will set port to 8443, site name to default)

Field.Label: selecting UDM(pro) will automatically: 1. activate (w. same IP#) SW#14, USG, AP#4 (for UDM not -PRO) 2. set controller info to ON or UDM
There can be several sets of UserIDs-password - They could all be the same, depending on YOUR setup

. 1. the UID-password you use to login via web browser (http) to your UniFi controller . 2. the unix UID-password when you ssh in terminal to the WiFi-AP, Switch, Router . 3. the unix UID-passwd when you ssh in terminal to the UDM pro

for UniFi controller v 6.x MAC OS 10.14 or greater is neeed. MAC OS 10.13 and lower do not support the proper ssl/tsl security required by unifi controller v 6.x software Leave userid and password blank if you want to disable querying the controller
Option for login to CONTROLLER webpage. This option might be needed for UDM non pro depending on config/setup/version
2. .............................. ssh unix UserID of AP,SW,GW - not UDM:
.. disable strict host checking (ignore know_hosts file for ssh) :

List.Option: UDM mode for WiFi, no reports (included in ON)

Field.tooltip: uses an https get /stat/alluser to get info of last_seen
Field.Label: Use unifi controler db info for Up -> Down:

List.Option: ALL unifi client devices, ignores individual dev settings
PER-DEVICE: only if enabled in unifi client dev edit

PluginConfig.Field: > When enabled plugin will check the controller db info for last_seen time if other info suggest up->down to confirm or supspend up->down for "expirationtime" seconds This might be usefull if the individual AP gives sometimes faulty down info. This info is slow for down -> up info, might take several minutes before a devices shows up in the controller ==> req. "use controler info"=ON ALL and OFF will ignore individual device settings

Field.Label: ..site ID (not name) in eg http... (8)443/manage/site/>default</, leave empty for default:
in most cases do not touch this, it will auto adapt
.. controller port #, leave empty for auto detect
use this option only if port # is not 8443 or 443 or if you have another system that uses one of these ports

List.Option: do not check if port number is ok

Field.Label: set to off and port to 443 if controller v >= 6.5.55 and you have connection problems
Backup of controller files - once a day ...............................:
it will add ~20Mbyte to the backup dir every day, it will NOT delete old backup files
This will automatically activate switch#12, AP#4 and Controller at the same IP number as the UDM, enabling of AP4,SW12.. is not needed

This is used as AP device part of a UDM system (not UDM-pro)
run message listener process on Gateway

Use gateway listeners(/var/log/messages and Database dump) for DHCP-client info. The USG (newer versions) does not show any relevant info in the message logfile, then you will see a lot of listener restart message for GWtail. Then disable listener process

Count AP and Downlink clients in total clients count in Switch:
Use switch command version (for POE on/off):

The plugin supports 2 methods to set POE on/off/cycle. CLI is the older way. Some of the new switches only support unix swctrl command. With a recent software version also older switches support swctrl command.

This is used as switch device part of a UDM system

To setup: select the querry every time parametes etc Currently the protect system must be on the same hardware as the controller eg cloudkey 2, UMDpro. Once started the plugin will query(http) protect and will get all cameras installed and create the appropritate indigo devices It then will query(http) the protect system for new events every x secs The events can be of type Motion/Person/Vehicle/Ring. One physical ring can create several events eg motion+person+ring in differnt sequences depending on how a person approaches the doorbell Then for each event the variables - Unifi_Camera_with_Event - Unifi_Camera_Event_PathToThumbnail - Unifi_Camera_Event_DateOfThumbNail - Unifi_Camera_Event_Date are updated as they come in. The event date is the first variable tio be updated, some of the other images can take several seconds to be produced. You can trigger on any of these variables or on the device states: lastRing or eventStart. eventEnd is set when the event is over. In most cases the thumbnail should be ready.
In menu / CAMERA - protect Info ... you can print camera info to the logfile and get a snap shot and set several parameetrs on the caameras in actions you can setup most of the config as as well as get snapshots
..target path to most recent event thumbnails:
... (6) http connection to unifi devices show commands:
... (6.1) http connection to unifi devices show result:
... (14) controller db http get client info:
... (16) dump dict msgs to prefs dir:
. for DETAILED time tracking set indigo variable "enableTimeTracking_UniFi"
... enable or stop or print intermediate results use on/off/print:

Field.tooltip: try a differnt value in case you have a lot of excessive wait times, listeners should not start all at the same time
Field.Label: Wait between launch of listeners:
The plugin will auto restart if parameters is changed float numbers are used to reduce likelyhood that 2 launches overlap too closely
... force restart of UnifFi devices when mca error encountered:
When you have several unforced restarts through lost connections, it might be a good idea to force them every xx hours
= set warning levels, set higher for slower server
... max time for excessive time for whole update queue:
... max time for excessive time for single update:
... Size of buffer for reading input streams:

For error 22: reduce buffer size until error disappears In general max value for best performance. 16k seems to cover 90% of packages. Each listener stream will use one of the buffers + several copies Small read buffer will do several reads when data is > buffer size, When the mac has less ram, a smaller values might be needed to avoid read errors (error 22)
